definition: A condition affecting pregnant females, caused by previously diagnosed, or diagnosed within the first 20 weeks, hypertension and associated heart disease. This condition is characterised by blood pressure of 140/90 mmHg or greater, leading to a complication during pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium. Confirmation is by sphygmomanometer.

title: Other or unspecified disorders of breast associated with childbirth
Labour or delivery complicated by fetal heart rate anomaly
definition: A condition characterised by an abnormal fetal heart rate. This condition leads to further difficulties and complications during labour and delivery. Confirmation is by Doppler ultrasound.

title: Maternal care for known or suspected disproportion
definition: A condition characterised by the provision of health interventions to the mother due to the situation in which a the head or body of the fetus is too large to fit through the pelvis of the mother.

title: Spontaneous abortion
definition:
Spontaneous abortion (also referred to as miscarriage) is a spontaneous loss of pregnancy (i.e. embryo or fetus) before 22 completed weeks of gestation. When information on gestational age is unavailable, use birthweight less than 500 grams as the criteria.
Spontaneous abortions (miscarriages) are distinct from cases of induced abortion.

title: Other viral diseases complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Obstructed labour due to unusually large fetus
Maternal care for abnormality of vulva or perineum
Diseases of the respiratory system complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Blighted ovum or nonhydatidiform mole
definition: A condition caused by genetic abnormality, abnormal cell division, or poor quality ovum or sperm. This condition is characterised by a failed pregnancy, implantation of a fertilized egg without development into an embryo, haemorrhage into the decidua, and adjacent tissue necrosis.

title: Maternal care related to premature rupture of membranes
definition: Spontaneous rupture of fetal membranes before the onset of labour.

title: Certain maternal diseases classifiable elsewhere but complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Other immediate postpartum haemorrhage
definition: A condition characterised by excessive loss of blood within the first 24 hours after the completion of the third stage of labour for a vaginal delivery (more than 500 millilitres), or after a caesarean section (more than 1000 millilitres). This condition is caused by uterine atony, trauma, retained placenta, or coagulopathy.

title: Certain obstetric conditions, not elsewhere classified
definition: Any condition characterised by an obstetric complication, condition, disease, or death during pregnancy, labour and delivery, or the puerperium that is not elsewhere classified.

title: Sequelae of complication of pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: A secondary condition that develops during the period of time from conception to delivery (pregnancy), during labour and delivery (childbirth) or during the six weeks following delivery (puerperium).

title: Maternal care for known or suspected abnormality of pelvic organs
definition: A condition characterised by the provision of health interventions to the mother due to some abnormality that is either suspected or known to be present in of one or more of her pelvic organs.

title: Obstructed labour due to locked twins
Failed induction of labour
definition: A condition characterised by a failed attempt to stimulate contractions before the spontaneous onset of labour. This condition may occur with or without ruptured membranes.

title: Prolonged first stage of labour
definition: The first stage of labour where cervical dilatation progresses less than 1 centimetre per hour for a minimum of 4 hours. Protracted descent is less than 1 centimetre per hour for nulliparas and less than 2 centimetre per hour for multiparas.

title: Spontaneous abortion, complete or unspecified, with other or unspecified complications
Preterm delivery following iatrogenic induction of labour or caesarean section
Galactorrhoea
definition: Excessive or inappropriate lactation in females or males, and not necessarily related to pregnancy. Galactorrhoea can occur either unilaterally or bilaterally, and be profuse or sparse. Its most common cause is hyperprolactinemia.

title: Failed medical abortion, with other or unspecified complications
definition: Medical interventions which fail to terminate the pregnancy and associated with other and unspecified complications.

title: Failed medical abortion, complicated by genital tract or pelvic infection
definition: Medical interventions which fail to terminate the pregnancy and complicated by genital tract and pelvic infection

title: Premature rupture of membranes, onset of labour after 24 hours
Preterm labour or delivery
definition:
A condition characterised by the onset of labour and delivery before 37 completed weeks.

Assign an additional extension code, if desired, for Duration of pregnancy.

title: Unspecified abortion, incomplete, with other or unspecified complications
Complications of anaesthesia during labour or delivery
definition: Any complication caused by or subsequent to any anaesthetic intervention used during labour and delivery.

title: Other manipulation-assisted delivery
definition: A condition caused by the development of a fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of a neonate from the uterus using other manipulation-assisted interventions or techniques to assist the delivery.

title: Pruritus of pregnancy
definition: Pruritus in pregnancy can usually be attributed to a specific cause such as cholestasis, a pregnancy-specific dermatosis such as pruritic urticarial papules and plaques of pregnancy, or to exacerbation of a preexisting inflammatory dermatosis such as atopic eczema. Not uncommonly, however, a specific cause cannot be identified.

title: Induced abortion, incomplete, complicated by genital tract or pelvic infection
Induced abortion, incomplete, complicated by delayed or excessive haemorrhage
Maternal care for transverse or oblique lie
Infections of genitourinary tract in pregnancy
Oedema, proteinuria, or hypertensive disorders in pregnancy, childbirth, or the puerperium
definition: Any disorder affecting pregnant females, characterised by excessive systemic fluid build-up, excess serum proteins in the urine, and abnormally elevated blood pressure during pregnancy, childbirth, or the puerperium.

title: Labour or delivery complicated by vascular lesion of cord
definition: A condition characterised by complications during labour and delivery that is caused by vascular lesion of the umbilical cord.

title: Maternal care for other known or suspected fetal problems
definition: A condition characterised by the provision of health interventions to the mother due to any other issue that is either suspected or known to be present in the fetus.

title: Retained intrauterine contraceptive device in pregnancy
definition: Any reason for encounter to assess (or care for) a mother with a retained intrauterine contraceptive device during pregnancy.

title: Induced abortion, complete or unspecified, complicated by delayed or excessive haemorrhage
definition: A condition caused by surgical, pharmacological, mechanical, artificial, or other unspecified interventions and complicated by delayed or excessive bleeding. This condition is characterised by termination of pregnancy and intentional embryonic or fetal death with complete or unspecified expulsion of products of conception from the uterus before the fetus is viable.

title: Abscess of breast associated with childbirth
Pre-existing secondary hypertension complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females, caused by renal disease, endocrine disorders, or tumours. This condition is characterised by blood pressure greater than 140/90 mmHg prior to the 20th week of pregnancy, or persisting longer than 12 weeks postpartum, leading to a complication during pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium. Confirmation is by sphygmomanometer.

title: Late vomiting of pregnancy
definition: Vomiting occurring after 22 completed weeks of gestation.

title: Other complications of spinal or epidural anaesthesia during labour or delivery
Obstructed labour due to face presentation
Single spontaneous delivery
definition: A condition caused by the development of a fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by spontaneous parturition of a neonate from the uterus.

title: Labour or delivery complicated by other cord entanglement, with compression
Long labour
definition: Any condition characterised by a longer than average parturition between the initiation of regular, rhythmic, and painful contractions and cervical dilation, to the delivery of the placenta.

title: Pulmonary complications of anaesthesia during the puerperium
Gestational pemphigoid
definition:
Gestational pemphigoid (pemphigoid gestationis) is an autoimmune skin disease characterised by pruritic plaques and blister formation on the skin in association with pregnancy or the trophoblastic tumours, hydatiform mole and choriocarcinoma. The exact causes of the disease are unknown but the disease is mediated by auto-antibodies to the hemidesmosome component BP180/BPAg2/collagen XVII. The maternal antibodies may cause short lived disease in the neonate, neonatal pemphigoid gestationis. 
This disease is not an infection with herpes virus despite its old name, herpes gestationis.

title: Maternal care for disproportion due to generally contracted pelvis
Complications predominantly related to the puerperium
definition: A group of conditions characterised as any adverse evolution (complication) which may arise during the approximately six weeks after delivery during which the uterus returns to the original size (puerperium).

title: Loss of pregnancy after abortion or intrauterine death of one fetus or more
Delivery
definition: Birth of one or more neonates from the uterus either spontaneously, assisted, or by caesarean section.

title: Failed instrumental induction of labour
definition: A condition characterised by a failed attempt to instrumentally stimulate contractions before the spontaneous onset of labour. This condition may occur with or without ruptured membranes.

title: Mild hyperemesis gravidarum
definition: Vomiting occurring during pregnancy responsive to dietary modification and antiemetic treatment

title: Pre-existing essential hypertension complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females, caused by previously diagnosed, or diagnosed within the first 20 weeks, hypertension. This condition is characterised by blood pressure of 140/90 mmHg or greater, leading to a complication during pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium. Confirmation is by sphygmomanometer.

title: Maternal care for disproportion due to hydrocephalic fetus
Induced abortion, complete or unspecified, without complication
Viral hepatitis complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Complete hydatidiform mole
definition: A condition caused by the over-production of cells arising into the placenta during pregnancy. This condition is characterised by a pregnancy with abnormal placental growth in which the chorionic villi become hydropic, slight to severe trophoblast proliferation and invasion of the uterine tissue within 10-16 weeks after conception, a placental mass, 25-30% theca lutein cysts, 15-20% persistent trophoblastic disease, 50% uterine size for dates, and vaginal bleeding, nausea, or vomiting. This condition leads to an absent fetus.

title: Maternal care related to complications specific to multiple gestation
Renal failure following abortion, ectopic or molar pregnancy
Spontaneous breech delivery
definition: A condition caused by the development of a fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by spontaneous parturition of a neonate in breech position from the uterus.

title: Maternal care for known or suspected central nervous system malformation in fetus
Maternal infectious diseases classifiable elsewhere but complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: Maternal infectious and parasitic diseases classifiable elsewhere but complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium

title: Maternal care related to false labour
definition: Contractions suggestive of labour but which do not lead to cervical dilatation.

title: Infections of other parts of urinary tract in pregnancy
definition: Infections of urinary tract other than kidney, bladder and urethra occurring during pregnancy

title: Secondary uterine inertia
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females that is idiopathic. This condition is characterised by vigorous contractions that decrease in vigour due to exhaustion or dehydration of the individual. This condition leads to lack of labour progress.

title: Obstetric haematoma of pelvis
definition: An injury characterised by a collection of extravasated blood trapped in the pelvic tissues. This injury is caused by or subsequent to the process of (or any intervention related to) pregnancy, or labour and delivery. This condition may also present with bruising or blood clots in the pelvic area.

title: Fourth degree perineal laceration during delivery
definition: Perineal lacerations extending through the rectum's mucosa to expose its lumen.

title: Primary uterine inertia
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females characterised by insufficiently strong or inappropriately coordinated rhythmic activity of the myometrium during labour to efface and dilate the cervix.

title: Preterm labour with term delivery
definition: A condition characterised by the spontaneous onset of labour before 37 completed weeks followed by a delivery after 39 weeks.

title: Death from sequelae of indirect obstetric cause
definition: Any condition resulting in death via an intermediate cause due to a pathological condition resulting from any adverse evolution (complication) which may arise associated with the period of time from conception to delivery (pregnancy), during labour and delivery (childbirth) or during the approximately six weeks after delivery during which the uterus returns to the original size (puerperium).

title: Delayed delivery of successive neonates
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females, characterised by the delayed spontaneous or caesarean section delivery of the successive neonates in a multiple delivery.

title: Spontaneous abortion, incomplete, complicated by genital tract or pelvic infection
Multiple delivery
definition: A condition caused by the development of more than one fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of more than one neonate from the uterus either spontaneously, assisted, or by caesarean section.

title: Abnormal haematological finding on antenatal screening of mother
definition: A sign characterised by an abnormality detected by haematology during an antenatal screening of the mother.

title: Precipitate labour
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females that is idiopathic. This condition is characterised by rapid labour and the lack of time for standard obstetric preparations or procedures leading to the delivery of the newborn. This condition leads to vaginal bleeding, frequent strong contractions, feelings of defecation, crowning of the fetus head at the vaginal introitus, or bulging of the amniotic sac.

title: Obstructed labour due to pelvic outlet or mid-cavity contraction
Vaginal delivery following previous caesarean section
Intrapartum haemorrhage resulting from obstructed labour with uterine rupture
Maternal care related to premature separation of placenta
Maternal care for fetal growth restriction
Certain specified maternal disorders predominantly related to pregnancy
definition: A group of conditions of the mother which occur during the period of time from conception to delivery (pregnancy).

title: Single delivery by caesarean section
definition: A condition caused by the development of a fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of a single neonate from the uterus by caesarean section.

title: Genital tract or pelvic infection following abortion, ectopic or molar pregnancy
Preterm spontaneous labour with preterm delivery
definition: A condition characterised by the spontaneous onset of labour and delivery before 37 completed weeks.

title: Delayed or secondary postpartum haemorrhage
definition: A condition characterised by excessive loss of blood between 24 hours and 12 weeks after delivery. This condition is caused by uterine atony, trauma, retained placenta, or coagulopathy.

title: Obstetric air embolism
definition: A condition characterised by the lodging of a gas bubble (air embolus) in the bloodstream, which can cause a blockage associated with the physiological and other changes that occur during the period of time from conception to delivery (pregnancy), during labour and delivery (childbirth) or during the approximately six weeks after delivery during which the uterus returns to the original size (puerperium).

title: Premature rupture of membranes, labour delayed by therapy
Delivery of viable fetus in abdominal pregnancy
definition: A condition caused by the development of a viable fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of a viable neonate from the abdominal cavity, at the culmination of an abdominal pregnancy.

title: Unspecified abortion, complete or unspecified, complicated by delayed or excessive haemorrhage
Maternal care for disproportion due to inlet contraction of pelvis
Infections of kidney in pregnancy
definition: Kidney infections occurring during pregnancy

title: Central nervous system complications of anaesthesia during the puerperium
Obstructed labour due to deformed pelvis
Other complications of spinal or epidural anaesthesia during the puerperium
Infections of urethra in pregnancy
definition: Urethra infections occurring during pregnancy

title: Gestational hypertension
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females, characterised by systolic blood pressure greater than 140mmHg and/or a diastolic blood pressure greater or equal to 90mmHg on two occasions, 4 hours or more apart. Can be newly diagnosed after 20 weeks gestation or before 1 week postpartum. Confirmation is by measurement of blood pressure, liver and kidney functions test, and urine test.

title: Labour or delivery complicated by vasa praevia
definition: A condition characterised by complications during labour and delivery that is caused when the umbilical vessels traverse the membranes of the internal cervical os.

title: Induced abortion, complete or unspecified, with other complication
Spontaneous vertex delivery
definition: A condition caused by the development of a fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by spontaneous parturition of a neonate in vertex position from the uterus.

title: Threatened abortion
definition: A bloody vaginal discharge of bleeding appears through a closed cervical os during the first half of pregnancy.

title: Infection of amniotic sac or membranes
Multiple delivery, all by caesarean section
definition: A condition caused by the development of more than one fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of more than one neonate from the uterus by caesarean section.

title: Subluxation of symphysis pubis in pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: Any reason for encounter to assess (or care for) a mother for subluxation of pubis symphysis during pregnancy.

title: Abnormalities of forces of labour
definition: Any condition affecting pregnant females, characterised by an anomaly or dysfunction to the tissues or processes associated with the natural progression of labour. These conditions may lead to further complications during labour and childbirth.

title: Maternal care for other conditions predominantly related to pregnancy
definition: Any reason for encounter to assess (or care for) a mother for other conditions predominantly related to pregnancy.

title: Eclampsia, time period unspecified
definition: Onset of convulsions in a women with preeclampsia not attributable to other causes without a specific onset time

title: Failed medical induction of labour
definition: A condition characterised by a failed attempt to stimulate contractions pharmacologically before the spontaneous onset of labour. This condition may occur with or without ruptured membranes.

title: Preterm labour without delivery
definition: A condition characterised by the onset of labour before 37 completed weeks, without delivery.

title: Malnutrition in pregnancy
definition: A condition caused by ingestion of a diet in which the nutrients are lacking or are in excess.

title: Retained portions of placenta or membranes, without haemorrhage
definition: A condition characterised by portions of a placenta and membranes that have not been expelled from the uterus during the third stage of labour and up to 30 minutes following delivery, and without haemorrhage. This condition is caused by uterine atony, a trapped placenta, or a placenta accreta. This condition may lead to primary postpartum haemorrhage or infection.

title: Diseases of the skin complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: Diseases of the skin or subcutaneous tissue not specifically related to pregnancy but which contribute to increased morbidity during pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium, for example genetic blistering disorders or lichen sclerosus.

title: Infections of bladder in pregnancy
definition: Bladder infections occurring during pregnancy

title: Spontaneous abortion, complete or unspecified, complicated by delayed or excessive haemorrhage
definition: A condition caused by immunological factors, abnormal ovum or uterine body, maternal disease or infection, or cervical incompetence, and complicated by delayed or excessive bleeding. This condition is characterised by non-induced embryonic or fetal death or passage of products of conception prior to 22 weeks' gestation or weighing less than 500 grams.

title: Death from any obstetric cause occurring more than 42 days but less than one year after delivery
definition: A condition characterised by maternal death between 43 days and one year following delivery. This death is caused by any physiological, obstetrical, or other changes or is provoked by interventions used during pregnancy, childbirth, or puerperium.

title: Obstructed labour due to incomplete rotation of fetal head
Postpartum thyroiditis
definition: Postpartum thyroiditis (PPT) is the occurrence, in the postpartum period, of transient hyperthyroidism and/or transient hypothyroidism, with most women returning to the euthyroid state by 1 year postpartum.

title: Diabetes mellitus arising in pregnancy
definition: Diabetes mellitus arising or diagnosed in pregnancy (per WHO criteria or other national criteria)-Gestational diabetes. Gestational diabetes mellitus is defined as any degree of glucose intolerance with onset or first recognition during pregnancy. The definition applies regardless of whether insulin or only diet modification is used for treatment or whether the condition persists after pregnancy.

title: Other or unspecified failed attempted abortion, complicated by embolism
Diseases of the digestive system complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Cardiac complications of anaesthesia during the puerperium
Failed or difficult intubation during the puerperium
Breech extraction
definition: A condition caused by the development of a fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of a neonate in breech position from the uterus using breech extraction interventions or techniques to assist the delivery.

title: Obstetric damage to pelvic joints or ligaments
definition: An injury characterised by damage to the pelvic joints and ligaments. This injury is caused by or subsequent to the process of (or any intervention related to) pregnancy, or labour and delivery.

title: Pre-existing hypertension complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females, caused by previously diagnosed maternal hypertension. This condition is characterised by any complication during pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium as a result of a blood pressure reading above 140/90 mmHg prior to the 20th week of pregnancy, or persisting longer than 12 weeks postpartum. Confirmation is by sphygmomanometer.

title: Pregnancy dermatoses
definition: A group of skin disorders which are specific to pregnancy.

title: Other or unspecified failed attempted abortion, with other or unspecified complications
Awareness under general anaesthesia during the puerperium
Molar pregnancy
definition: A condition caused by the over-production of cells arising into the placenta during pregnancy. This condition is characterised by a pregnancy with abnormal placental growth in which the chorionic villi become hydropic, trophoblast proliferation and invasion of the uterine tissue within 10-16 weeks after conception, and a placental mass.

title: Complications of labour or delivery
definition: Any complication characterised by the adverse evolution of a condition that arises during any one of the three stages of labour and delivery.

title: Obstructed labour due to compound presentation
Spontaneous abortion, incomplete, complicated by delayed or excessive haemorrhage
definition: A condition caused by immunological factors, abnormal ovum or uterine body, maternal disease or infection, or cervical incompetence and complicated by delayed or excessive bleeding. This condition is characterised by passage of products of conception prior to 22 weeks gestation or weighing less than 500 grams.

title: Maternal care for face, brow or chin presentation
Unspecified abortion, incomplete, complicated by genital tract or pelvic infection
Failed medical abortion, without complication
definition: Medical interventions which fail to terminate the pregnancy without any associated complications.

title: Maternal care for viable fetus in abdominal pregnancy
Maternal care for congenital malformation of uterus
definition: Care provided for the pregnant female necessary due to malformation of the pregnant female's uterus present at or before the time of birth.

title: Tubal pregnancy
definition: A condition characterised by implantation of the embryo within the fallopian tube (ampullary, isthmus, interstitium) during pregnancy.

title: Delayed delivery after spontaneous or unspecified rupture of membranes
definition: A complication characterised by a delayed neonatal delivery after the spontaneous or unspecified rupture of the membranes.

title: Maternal care for abnormality of vagina
definition: Care provided for the pregnant female necessary due to some abnormality of the vagina.

title: Obstructed labour due to shoulder dystocia
Continuing pregnancy after abortion of one fetus or more
Aspiration pneumonitis due to anaesthesia during labour or delivery
definition: Massive gastric inhalation causing pulmonary insufficiency from aspiration pneumonitis due to anaesthesia during labour and delivery

title: Severe pre-eclampsia
definition: This condition is characterised by systolic blood pressure greater than 160mmHg and or diastolic greater or equal to 110mmHg on two occasions 4 hours or more apart in the presence of either proteinuria or other new onset maternal organ dysfunction characterised by one thrombocytopenia, elevated serum creatinine or liver transaminases, or neurological conditions or fetal growth restriction.

title: Spontaneous abortion, complete or unspecified, complicated by genital tract or pelvic infection
Maternal care related to placenta praevia or low lying placenta
definition: A placenta that is implanted over or very near the internal cervical os--total, partial, marginal, low-lying placenta

title: Other or unspecified disorders of lactation
Unspecified abortion, incomplete, complicated by embolism
Maternal care due to uterine scar from previous surgery
Spontaneous abortion, complete or unspecified, complicated by embolism
definition: A condition caused by immunological factors, abnormal ovum or uterine body, maternal disease or infection, or cervical incompetence, and complicated by embolism. This condition is characterised by non-induced embryonic or fetal death or passage of products of conception prior to 22 weeks gestation or weighing less than 500 grams.

title: Continuing pregnancy after intrauterine death of one fetus or more
Multiple delivery by combination of methods with caesarean
Spinal or epidural anaesthesia-induced headache during the puerperium
Central nervous system complications of anaesthesia during pregnancy
Maternal care related to prolonged pregnancy
definition: Pregnancy that has exceeded a duration of 42 weeks from the last menstrual period.

title: Postpartum haemorrhage following obstructed labour without mention of uterine rupture
Obstetric high vaginal laceration
definition: An injury characterised by a laceration in the upper third area of the vagina. This injury is caused by or subsequent to the process of (or any intervention related to) pregnancy, or labour and delivery.

title: Placenta praevia specified as without haemorrhage
Maternal care for disproportion due to deformity of maternal pelvic bones
Unspecified abortion, complete or unspecified, without complication
Pre-existing hypertensive heart and renal disease complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: Blood pressure of 140 mm Hg or greater systolic and/or 90 mm Hg or greater diastolic diagnosed preconception or in the first 20 weeks of pregnancy with associated heart and renal disease

title: Multiple delivery, all spontaneous
definition: A condition caused by the development of more than one fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of more than one neonate spontaneously from the uterus.

title: Obstructed labour due to generally contracted pelvis
Maternal care for tumour of corpus uteri
definition: Care provided for the pregnant female necessary due to the presence of a uterine tumour at the time of pregnancy.

title: Induced abortion, incomplete, complicated by embolism
Failed medical abortion, complicated by delayed or excessive haemorrhage
definition: Medical interventions which fail to terminate the pregnancy and complicated by delayed or excessive haemorrhage

title: Varicose veins of lower extremity in pregnancy
Destructive operation for delivery
definition: A condition caused by the development of a fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of a neonate using destructive operation interventions or techniques to assist the delivery.

title: HELLP syndrome
definition: severe preeclampsia associated with haemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, or low platelets

title: Labour or delivery complicated by biochemical evidence of fetal stress
definition: A condition characterised by complications during labour and delivery that is caused by biochemical evidence of fetal distress. Confirmation is by a fetal blood sample from a scalp prick through the open cervix during labour.

title: First degree perineal laceration during delivery
definition: Perineal lacerations involving the fourchette, perineal skin, and vaginal mucous membrane but not the underlying fascia and muscle.

title: Failed or difficult intubation during pregnancy
definition: A condition affecting females during pregnancy, caused by physiological, pathophysiological, or psychological factors that aggravate the tissues necessary to secure the tube. This condition is characterised by a difficulty or inability to insert a tube into an external or internal orifice of the body during pregnancy.

title: Unspecified abortion, complete or unspecified, with other or unspecified complications
Spontaneous abortion, complete or unspecified, without complication
Obstructed labour due to maternal pelvic abnormality
definition: Obstructed labour means that, in spite of strong contractions of the uterus, the fetus cannot descend through the pelvis because there is an insurmountable barrier preventing its descent. Obstruction usually occurs at the pelvic brim, but occasionally it may occur in the cavity or at the outlet of the pelvis. Complications resulting from obstructed labour can be avoided if a woman in obstructed labour is identified early and appropriate action is taken.

title: Other infections with a predominantly sexual mode of transmission complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Multiple delivery, all by forceps or vacuum extractor
definition: A condition caused by the development of more than one fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of more than one neonate from the uterus using forceps and vacuum extractor.

title: Other or unspecified failed attempted abortion, complicated by genital tract or pelvic infection
Maternal care related to the fetus, amniotic cavity or possible delivery problems
definition: A group of conditions characterised by the provision of health interventions to the mother due to conditions associated with the fetus, the amniotic cavity, or to issues associated with labour and delivery.

title: Infections of the genital tract in pregnancy
Other or unspecified failed attempted abortion, without complication
Retained placenta without haemorrhage
definition: A condition characterised by a placenta that has not been expelled from the uterus during the third stage of labour and up to 30 minutes following delivery, and without haemorrhage. This condition is caused by uterine atony, a trapped placenta, or a placenta accreta. This condition may lead to primary postpartum haemorrhage or infection.

title: Labour or delivery complicated by cord around neck, with compression
definition: A condition characterised by complications during labour and delivery that is caused by wrapping of the umbilical cord around the neck of the fetus, with compression.

title: Gestational oedema or proteinuria without hypertension
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females, characterised by excessive systemic fluid build-up and serum proteins in the urine, without an abnormally elevated blood pressure induced by pregnancy.

title: Abnormal radiological finding on antenatal screening of mother
definition: A sign characterised by an abnormality detected by radiology during an antenatal screening of the mother.

title: Maternal care for known or suspected malpresentation of fetus
definition: Care provided for the pregnant female for incorrect position or orientation of the fetus at near term or during labour, determined by its relation to the spine of the mother and the birth canal.

title: Obstructed labour due to malposition or malpresentation of fetus
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females, caused by the abnormal position of fetal head or the abnormal presentation of the fetus away from the fetal head in vertex.

title: Cerebral venous thrombosis in the puerperium
Maternal hypotension syndrome
definition: Any reason for encounter to assess a mother for low blood pressure during pregnancy.

title: Hyperemesis gravidarum with metabolic disturbance
definition: Vomiting in pregnancy, not responsive to dietary modification and antiemetic treatment and associated with electrolyte disturbances and acid-base imbalance

title: Other venous complications following abortion, ectopic or molar pregnancy
Maternal care for red cell antibodies
definition: Maternal care for rhesus or other isoimmunization

title: Spontaneous abortion, incomplete, complicated by embolism
definition: A condition caused by immunological factors, abnormal ovum or uterine body, maternal disease or infection, or cervical incompetence and complicated by embolism. This condition is characterised by passage of products of conception prior to 22 weeks gestation or weighing less than 500 grams.

title: Abnormal chromosomal or genetic finding on antenatal screening of mother
definition: A sign characterised by a chromosomal or genetic abnormality detected during an antenatal screening of the mother.

title: Ovarian pregnancy
definition: A condition characterised by implantation of the embryo within the ovary during pregnancy.

title: Spinal or epidural anaesthesia-induced headache during labour or delivery
False labour before 37 completed weeks of gestation
Tuberculosis complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Other infection of genital tract following delivery
Pyrexia during labour, not elsewhere classified
definition: A complication characterised by maternal fever during labour, and not elsewhere classified.

title: Delayed delivery after artificial rupture of membranes
definition: A complication characterised by a delayed neonatal delivery after the artificial rupture of the membranes.

title: Maternal care related to certain specified disorders of amniotic fluid or membranes
Abnormal ultrasonic finding on antenatal screening of mother
definition: A sign characterised by an abnormality detected by ultrasound during an antenatal screening of the mother.

title: Delayed or excessive haemorrhage following abortion, ectopic or molar pregnancy
Certain specified complications of labour or delivery, not elsewhere classified
Amniotic fluid embolism
definition: Amniotic fluid embolism is a rare obstetric emergency in which it is postulated that amniotic fluid, fetal cells, hair, or other debris enter the maternal circulation, causing cardiorespiratory collapse.

title: Human immunodeficiency disease complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Endocrine, nutritional or metabolic diseases complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: Any disease affecting pregnant females, characterised by endocrine, nutrition, or metabolic manifestations that complicate pregnancy, childbirth, or the puerperium.

title: Protozoal diseases complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Labour or delivery complicated by fetal distress
Other pulmonary complications of anaesthesia during labour or delivery
Induced abortion, complete or unspecified, complicated by genital tract or pelvic infection
Clinical findings on antenatal screening of mother
definition: Any sign characterised by an abnormality detected during an antenatal screening of the mother.

title: Abdominal pregnancy
definition: A condition characterised by implantation of the embryo within the peritoneal cavity during pregnancy.

title: Maternal care for known or suspected chromosomal abnormality in fetus
Obstetric embolism
definition: A condition characterised by the lodging of a blood clot, a fat globule or a gas bubble (embolus) in the bloodstream, which can cause a blockage associated with the physiological and other changes that occur during the period of time from conception to delivery (pregnancy), during labour and delivery (childbirth) or during the approximately six weeks after delivery during which the uterus returns to the original size (puerperium).

title: Induced abortion
definition: Induced abortion (also referred to as Artificial termination of pregnancy) is a complete expulsion or extraction from a woman of an embryo or a fetus (irrespective of the duration of the pregnancy), following a deliberate interruption of an ongoing pregnancy by medical or surgical means, which is not intended to result in a live birth. Induced abortions are distinct from cases of spontaneous abortion and stillbirth.

title: Shock during or following labour or delivery
definition: A syndrome characterised by systemic cellular hypoxia and organ dysfunction as a result of hypoperfusion following labour and delivery. This syndrome is caused by haemorrhage, vomiting, diarrhoea, inadequate fluid intake, or a systemic inflammatory response to bacteria, endotoxins, or exotoxins.

title: Obstetric laceration of cervix
definition: An injury characterised by a laceration to the cervix. This injury is caused by or subsequent to the process of (or any intervention related to) pregnancy, or labour and delivery.

title: Obstructed labour due to brow presentation
Intrapartum haemorrhage with coagulation defect
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females, excluding those caused by abruptio placentae and placenta praevia. This condition is characterised by excessive loss of blood with difficulties in blood clotting factors, after 20 weeks gestation until labour and delivery.

title: False labour at or after 37 completed weeks of gestation
Toxic reaction to local anaesthesia during labour or delivery
Pre-eclampsia superimposed on chronic hypertension
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females over 20 weeks gestation. This condition is characterised by systolic blood pressure greater than 140mmHg and diastolic greater or equal to 90mmHg on two occasions 4 hours apart in the presence of either proteinuria or other new onset maternal organ dysfunction characterised by one thrombocytopenia, elevated serum creatinine or liver transaminases, or neurological conditions or fetal growth restriction in a female diagnosed with pre-existing hypertension.

title: Rupture of uterus during labour
definition: An injury characterised by rupture of the myometrial wall of the uterus during labour. This injury is caused by or subsequent to the process of (or any intervention related to) pregnancy, or labour and delivery. This injury presents with abdominal pain, haemorrhage, or hypovolemic shock in the mother, or late decelerations, reduced variability, tachycardia, or bradycardia in the fetus.

title: Pulmonary complications of anaesthesia during pregnancy
Obstructed labour due to other causes
definition: Any other condition characterised by the inability of the presenting part of the fetus to progress into the birth canal for any reason.

title: Malaria complicating pregnancy, childbirth, or the puerperium
Intrapartum haemorrhage resulting from obstructed labour without mention of uterine rupture
definition: Labour and delivery complicated by intrapartum haemorrhage from obstructed labour due to not otherwise specified causes or without mention of uterine rupture

title: Eclampsia in labour
definition: This condition is characterised by seizure or convulsions newly arising in pregnancy. The condition is often associated with pregnancy-induced hypertension, convulsions, seizure, anxiety, epigastric pain, severe headache, blurred vision, proteinuria, and oedema that occurs during labour.

title: Gonorrhoea complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Obstetric blood-clot embolism
definition: A condition characterised by the lodging of a blood clot (a specific type of embolus known as a thrombus) in the bloodstream, which can cause a blockage associated with the physiological and other changes that occur during the period of time from conception to delivery (pregnancy), during labour and delivery (childbirth) or during the approximately six weeks after delivery during which the uterus returns to the original size (puerperium).

title: Spontaneous abortion, incomplete, with other or unspecified complications
Liver disorders in pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: Any disorder affecting females, characterised by pathological changes to the liver that occur during pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium.

title: Cardiac complications of anaesthesia during pregnancy
Other or unspecified failed attempted abortion, complicated by delayed or excessive haemorrhage
Single delivery by caesarean hysterectomy
definition: A condition caused by the development of a fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of a neonate from the uterus by caesarean section followed by removal of the uterus.

title: Cardiomyopathy in the puerperium
definition: A group of diseases in which the dominant feature is the involvement of the cardiac muscle itself occurring in puerperium, the period of 6-8 weeks after giving birth. Cardiomyopathies are classified according to their predominant pathophysiological features or their etiological/pathological factors.

title: Diseases of the circulatory system complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
Gestational oedema with proteinuria without hypertension
definition: The accumulation of fluid and proteinuria due to the physiological alterations of pregnancy in the absence of hypertension

title: Pre-eclampsia
definition: This condition is characterised by systolic blood pressure greater than 140mmHg and or diastolic greater or equal to 90mmHg on two occasions 4 hours or more apart in the presence of either proteinuria or other new onset maternal organ dysfunction characterised by one thrombocytopenia, elevated serum creatinine or liver transaminases, or neurological conditions or fetal growth restriction.

title: Diabetes mellitus in pregnancy
definition: A condition caused by dysfunctional maternal insulin receptors. This condition is characterised by glucose intolerance with onset or first recognition during pregnancy, with at least one of the following criteria met: fasting plasma glucose greater than or equal to 7.0 millimoles per litre (126 mg/ dL); 2-hour plasma glucose greater than or equal to 11.1 millimoles per litre (200 mg/dL) following a 75 gram oral glucose load; random plasma glucose greater than or equal to 11.1 millimoles per litre (200 mg/ dL). Confirmation is by an oral glucose tolerance test.

title: Postpartum inversion of uterus
definition: An injury characterised by uterine inversion and prolapse through the dilated cervix that occurs after the delivery of a neonate. This condition is caused by or subsequent to labour and delivery, commonly as a result of excessive fundal pressure or cord traction. This condition presents with postpartum haemorrhage.

title: Anaemia complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: A condition of the circulatory system affecting pregnant females, characterised by a haemoglobin level below 11 grams per decilitre that complicates pregnancy, childbirth, or the puerperium.

title: Cardiac complications of anaesthesia during labour or delivery
Other obstetric injury to pelvic organs
definition: Any injury characterised by damage to the maternal pelvic organs. These injuries are caused by or subsequent to the process of (or any intervention related to) pregnancy, or labour and delivery.

title: Spontaneous abortion, incomplete, without complication
definition: A condition caused by immunological factors, abnormal ovum or uterine body, maternal disease or infection, or cervical incompetence without any associated complications. This condition is characterised by passage of products of conception prior to 22 weeks gestation or weighing less than 500 grams.

title: Other diseases of the blood or blood-forming organs or certain disorders involving the immune mechanism complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: Any disease affecting pregnant females, characterised by pathological changes to the blood and blood-forming organs and pathological changes involving the immune mechanism that complicate pregnancy, childbirth, or the puerperium not classified elsewhere.

title: Perineal laceration during delivery
definition: An injury characterised by a laceration to the maternal perineum during delivery.

title: Single delivery by forceps or vacuum extractor
definition: A condition caused by the development of a fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of a neonate from the uterus using forceps and vacuum extractor to assist the delivery.

title: Obstetric death of unspecified cause
definition: A condition characterised by maternal death during pregnancy or within 42 days following delivery. This death may be associated with physiological, obstetrical, or other changes or is provoked by interventions used during pregnancy, childbirth, or puerperium, but has no specified cause.

title: Complications of anaesthesia during the puerperium
Pre-existing hypertensive renal disease complicating pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: A condition affecting pregnant females, caused by previously diagnosed, or diagnosed within the first 20 weeks, hypertension and associated renal disease. This condition is characterised by blood pressure of 140/90 mmHg or greater, leading to a complication during pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium. Confirmation is by sphygmomanometer.

title: Unspecified abortion, complete or unspecified, complicated by genital tract or pelvic infection
Central nervous system complications of anaesthesia during labour or delivery
Death from sequelae of obstetric causes
definition: A secondary condition of pregnant females, caused by and subsequent to any complications during pregnancy, childbirth, or puerperium. This condition is characterised by maternal death.

title: Other complications of obstetric surgery or procedures
definition: Any complication caused by or subsequent to obstetric surgery and procedures, and not elsewhere classified.

title: Maternal distress during labour or delivery
definition: A condition characterised by maternal anxiety, depression, or stress during labour and delivery.

title: Maternal care for multiple gestation with malpresentation of one fetus or more
Certain specified obstetric trauma
definition: Any injury characterised by maternal trauma. These injuries are caused by or subsequent to the process of (or any intervention related to) pregnancy, or labour and delivery.

title: Embolism following abortion, ectopic or molar pregnancy
Postpartum coagulation defects
definition: A condition characterised by excessive loss of blood following a vaginal or caesarean section delivery. This condition is caused by coagulation defects during the postpartum period.

title: Awareness under general anaesthesia during pregnancy
Maternal care for known or suspected fetal abnormality or damage
definition: A condition characterised by the provision of health interventions to the mother due to some abnormality or damage that is either suspected or known to be present in the fetus.

title: Obstructed labour due to foetopelvic disproportion, unspecified
Abnormal biochemical finding on antenatal screening of mother
definition: A sign characterised by an abnormality detected by biochemistry during an antenatal screening of the mother.

title: Eclampsia in pregnancy
definition: This condition is characterised by seizure or convulsions newly arising in pregnancy. The condition is often associated with pregnancy-induced hypertension, convulsions, seizure, anxiety, epigastric pain, severe headache, blurred vision, proteinuria, and oedema that occurs during pregnancy.

title: Death from sequelae of direct obstetric cause
definition: Any condition directly resulting in death due to a pathological condition resulting from any adverse evolution (complication) which may arise associated with the period of time from conception to delivery (pregnancy), during labour and delivery (childbirth) or during the approximately six weeks after delivery during which the uterus returns to the original size (puerperium).

title: Unspecified abortion, incomplete, complicated by delayed or excessive haemorrhage
Missed abortion
definition: A condition caused by genetic abnormality, abnormal cell division, or poor quality ovum or sperm. This condition is characterised by a failed pregnancy, immature fetal or embryonic death that is not expelled from the uterus for at least 8 weeks, and diminished uterine size. This condition may also present with maternal infection, blood clotting, fetal calcification, and resorption of conception products. Confirmation is by imaging.

title: Pregnancy, childbirth or the puerperium
definition: A group of conditions characterised as occurring during the period of time from conception to delivery (pregnancy), during labour and delivery (childbirth) or during the approximately six weeks after delivery during which the uterus returns to the original size (puerperium).

title: Other assisted breech delivery
definition: A condition caused by the development of a fetus to the culmination of the pregnancy period. This condition is characterised by parturition of a neonate in breech position from the uterus using other interventions or techniques to assist the delivery.

title: Second degree perineal laceration during delivery
definition: Perineal lacerations involve, in addition, the fascia and muscles of the perineal body but not the anal sphincter.

title: Abortive outcome of pregnancy
definition: A group of conditions characterised by pregnancy which does not result in live offspring. These conditions include e.g. abortion, ectopic pregnancy or molar pregnancy.

title: Certain specified complications of the puerperium
definition: A group of conditions characterised as any adverse evolution (complication) which may arise during the approximately six weeks after delivery during which the uterus returns to the original size (puerperium) which are not classified elsewhere.

title: Labour or delivery complicated by meconium in amniotic fluid
definition: A condition characterised by complications during labour and delivery that is caused by meconium in amniotic fluid.

title: Low weight gain in pregnancy
definition: Any reason for encounter to assess (or care for) a mother for low weight gain during pregnancy.

title: Toxic reaction to local anaesthesia during pregnancy
definition: A condition affecting females during pregnancy, caused by the properties or the concentration of the anaesthetic agent, or patient factors. This condition is characterised by a local or systemic toxic reaction leading to malfunctioning or failure of the neurovascular, central nervous, respiratory or cardiovascular systems with onset between 30 seconds and 60 minutes after administration of an anaesthetic.

title: Infections of breast associated with childbirth
Pulmonary haemorrhage originating in the perinatal period
definition: A condition characterised by bleeding from the lung which begins during the period of time around childbirth, especially the five months before and one month after birth.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by complications of fetal surgery
definition: A condition in the fetus due to an unfavourable evolution of a condition (complication) associated with a surgical health intervention applied to the fetus.

title: Intrauterine growth restriction associated with small for gestational age
definition: These infants are classified as small for gestational age but have also been subject to intrauterine growth restriction.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by surgical procedure on mother
definition: A group of conditions characterised by findings in the fetus or newborn due to conditions in the mother resulting from surgical health intervention.

title: Neonatal dermatoses due to maternal antibodies
definition: A range of antibody-mediated neonatal skin disorders due to transplacental transfer of maternal antibodies to the fetus. The relevant autoimmune disorder may or may not be apparent in the mother.

title: Neonatal phototherapy burn
definition: Burn resulting from phototherapy administered to neonate, usually for the treatment of neonatal jaundice.

title: Syndrome of infant of a diabetic mother, type 1 or 2, nongestational, insulin dependent
definition: Describes the range of effects on the infant born to a woman with pregestational diabetes mellitus (type 1 or type 2). Common neonatal effects include macrosomia, intrauterine growth restriction, birth injuries, congenital anomalies, hypoglycaemia, respiratory distress, caudal regression syndrome and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

title: Birth injury
definition: A group of conditions characterised by the presence of damage of the tissues and organs of a newly delivered child due to physical pressure or injury during delivery.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by other abnormalities of membranes
Neonatal candidosis
definition: A condition affecting neonates, caused by an infection with the fungi Candida. This condition is characterised by apnoea, thrombocytopenia, or decreasing respiratory function or other symptoms depending on the site of infection. Transmission is vertical (from the mother to the baby). Confirmation is by identification of Candida in a blood or urine sample.

title: Neonatal hyperbilirubinaemia due to breast milk inhibitor of bilirubin conjugation
definition: A paediatric condition characterised by persistently increased level of bilirubin above 85 umol/l (5 mg/dL) manifesting as yellowing of the eyes, skin, and other tissues of a newborn due to any chemical substance that prevents or decreases the production of breast milk by the mother.

title: Miscellaneous skin disorders in the neonate
Fetal blood loss from ruptured cord
definition: The umbilical cord can rupture during labour and delivery and lead to fetal blood loss. Possible reasons include: traction on an abnormally short cord, a cord that is entangled around the fetus, a thin friable cord, or a cord with vascular abnormalities. Fetal blood loss can also occur following accidental cord puncture during amniocentesis or following in utero cordocentesis or transfusion.

title: Prenatal intrauterine intestinal perforation due to intestinal atresia or stenosis
Congenital enterovirus infection
definition: Congenital viral infections with enteroviruses (including coxsackie viruses and ECHO viruses) is an infectious embryofetopathy that have been reported to cause fetal malformations, acute systemic illness in the newborn and long-term neurodevelopmental abnormalities

title: Fetus or newborn affected by complications of umbilical cord
Neonatal aspergillosis
definition: A disease affecting neonates, caused by an infection with the fungi Aspergillus. This disease presents with clinical symptoms depending on the site of infection. Transmission is by inhalation of Aspergillus spores, or direct contact. Confirmation is by identification of Aspergillus from affected sites.

title: Birth depression with associated metabolic acidaemia of cord blood
Congenital echovirus infection
definition: A disease affecting neonates, caused by an infection with enteric cytopathic human orphan (ECHO) virus in utero. This disease presents with various symptoms depending on the site of the infection, or may be asymptomatic. Transmission is by vertical transmission. Confirmation is by identification of ECHO virus in the neonate.

title: Neonatal kernicterus
definition: Kernicterus is a pathologic diagnosis of the neonate that is characterised by yellow staining of the basal ganglia following elevated bilirubin concentrations in the blood and/or a breech in the blood brain barrier more common in the premature infant or the sick term neonate. It is characterised later in infancy and childhood by hearing deficits, choreoathetosis, and varying degrees of cognitive deficit.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by amniocentesis
definition: Amniocentesis involves extracting a small sample of amniotic fluid surrounding the fetus. Risks include miscarriage or injury if the needle comes into contact with the fetus or placenta.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by precipitate delivery
definition: A precipitate delivery is one that is < 3 hours and where contractions are unusually severe. It commonly occurs in multiparous women or when labour has been induced. Due to the force and speed of delivery, trauma may occur to the mother and newborn. The mother may suffer from haemorrhage, perineal laceration, infection, or uterine rupture, and the newborn may suffer from subdural hematoma, anoxia, or fractures.

title: Congenital falciparum malaria
definition: A disease caused by an infection with the protozoan parasite Plasmodium falciparum in utero. This disease is characterised by fever, anaemia, splenomegaly, hepatomegaly, jaundice, regurgitation, diarrhoea, or poor feeding. This disease may also present with respiratory distress, drowsiness, or cyanosis. Transmission is by vertical transmission. Confirmation is by identification of the Plasmodium falciparum in a blood sample from the neonate.

title: Low birth weight of newborn
definition: A paediatric condition in which the infant is born weighing between 1500 and 2499 g.

title: Transitory endocrine or metabolic disorders specific to fetus or newborn
definition: A group of paediatric conditions in which there is a temporary disorder in a newborn or infant associated with changes in hormone production or utilization (endocrine system) or when abnormal chemical reactions in the body disrupt the normal processes of enzyme catalyzed reactions within tissue cells (metabolism), such as getting or making energy from consumed food.

title: Neonatal cardiac failure due to pulmonary overperfusion
definition: Neonatal cardiac failure due to pulmonary overperfusion

title: Polycythaemia neonatorum due to placental insufficiency or fetal intrauterine growth restriction
Metabolic acidaemia in newborn
definition: Metabolic acidaemia represents an increase in hydrogen ion concentration, usually due to the production of lactic acid following hypoxia or ischemia induced anaerobic metabolism. Acidaemia can also result from inborn errors of metabolism, and disorders of the kidney and liver.

title: Congenital hypertonia
definition: A paediatric condition characterised by abnormally increased muscle tone that is present at birth in a newborn.

title: Neonatal vaginal or uterine haemorrhage
definition: A condition characterised by bleeding from the vagina of a newborn which is excessive or lasts longer than the first month of life.

title: Cardiac arrhythmias in the neonate
definition: Abnormal electrical rhythm, both tachyarrhythmias and bradyarrhythmias, in neonate

title: Cerebellar haemorrhage due to birth injury
definition: Haemorrhage into the cerebellum, hemispheres or vermis, due to trauma. Occipitaloseodiastasis with breech delivery is the most common cause of this injury.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by maternal respiratory diseases
Fetus or newborn affected by complications of placenta
definition: A group of conditions characterised by findings in the fetus or newborn due to an adverse evolution (complication) associated with the placenta, umbilical cord, or chorioamniotic membranes.

title: Neonatal hyperglycaemia due to iatrogenic intravenous therapy
Environmental hyperthermia of newborn
definition: A paediatric condition characterised by a core body temperature above 37.5 degrees C (99.5 degrees F) in a newborn due to exposure of the newborn to prolonged or extremely high environmental temperature.

title: Sclerema neonatorum
definition: Sclerema neonatorum is an uncommon condition which typically affects gravely ill, preterm neonates in the first week of life. It manifests as a diffuse hardening of skin and subcutaneous adipose tissue such that the skin cannot be pitted or picked up and pinched into a fold. Histologically there is minimal inflammation without fat necrosis. It is associated with a high mortality.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by maternal blood loss
Extreme prematurity of newborn, gestational age 25 completed weeks
definition: Extreme prematurity of newborn, gestational age 25 weeks, 0 days through 25 weeks, 6 days

title: Disturbances of sodium balance of newborn
definition: A paediatric condition characterised by abnormally high or low levels of sodium in the blood in a newborn, when the normal range is defined as 135 to 150 mEq/L.

title: Intraventricular nontraumatic haemorrhage, grade 4, of fetus or newborn
Intrapartum fetal death
definition:
Intrapartum fetal death is a fetal death during labour. If vital status of the fetus at the onset of labour is unknown, consider it was intrapartum if there is fresh skin appearance or no signs of maceration at the time of delivery.

Intrapartum stillbirth - is the complete expulsion or extraction from a woman of a fetus following an intrapartum fetal death at 22 or more completed weeks of gestation; or if gestational age is not available with a birthweight of 500 grams or more.

title: Extremely low birth weight of newborn, 750-999g
Neurological disorders specific to the perinatal or neonatal period
definition: A group of paediatric conditions characterised by an abnormal change in the cerebral status of a newborn.

title: Extremely low birth weight of newborn
definition: Newborn birth weight 999 g or less. Infants have increased morbidity including neurosensory disability, cerebral palsy, retinopathy of prematurity, deafness, pulmonary immaturity, chronic lung disease and subnormal cognitive function.

title: Very low birth weight of newborn, 1000-1249g
definition: A paediatric condition in which the infant is born weighing between 1000 and 1249 g.

title: Neonatal bleeding originating in the mouth, nose or pharynx
Hypothermia of newborn
definition: Core body temperature of a newborn below -1SD (36.0 degrees C) compared with mean temperature (36.5 degrees of C).

title: Antepartum fetal death
definition:
Antepartum fetal death is a fetal death before the onset of labour. If vital status of the fetus at the onset of labour is unknown, consider it was antepartum if there is presence of signs of maceration at the time of delivery.

Macerated stillbirth - is the complete expulsion or extraction from a woman of a fetus following a fetal death at 22 or more completed weeks of gestation; or if gestational age is not available with a birthweight of 500g or more with skin showing signs of maceration.

Antepartum stillbirth - is the complete expulsion or extraction from a woman of a fetus following an antepartum fetal death at 22 or more completed weeks of gestation; or if gestational age is not available with a birthweight of 500 grams or more.

title: Syndrome of infant of mother with gestational diabetes
definition: Describes the range of effects on the infant born to a woman with gestational diabetes (onset or first recognition of carbohydrate intolerance of variable severity in pregnancy). Common neonatal effects include macrosomia, intrauterine growth restriction, birth injuries, congenital anomalies, hypoglycaemia, respiratory distress, and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

title: Neonatal withdrawal syndrome from maternal use of drugs of addiction
definition: Intrauterine exposure to addictive drugs can lead to neonatal withdrawal symptoms. Withdrawal symptoms are usually neurological, preventing normal autonomic function. The clinical presentation of drug withdrawal is variable and dependent on several factors, such as, the type and dose of drug used, and rate of metabolism and excretion of the mother and infant.

title: Disturbances of potassium balance of newborn
definition: A paediatric condition characterised by abnormally high or low levels of potassium in the blood in a newborn, when the normal range is defined as 3.5 to 5.5 mmol/L.

title: Congenital toxoplasmosis
definition: A disease caused by an infection with the protozoan parasite Toxoplasma gondii in utero. This disease is characterised by chorioretinitis, hydrocephalus, intracranial calcifications, anaemia, or neurological deficits that develop after birth. This disease may present at birth with jaundice, premature birth, hepatosplenomegaly, myocarditis, pneumonitis, or rash. Transmission is by vertical transmission. In the fetus, confirmation is by identification of Toxoplasma gondii in amniotic fluid; in the neonate, confirmation is by identification of Toxoplasma gondii in body fluids or tissues, or detection of antibodies against Toxoplasma gondii.

title: Neonatal aspiration of amniotic fluid or mucus
definition: Clinical symptoms of Neonatal aspiration syndrome due to inhalation of amniotic fluid

title: Hydrops fetalis not due to haemolytic disease
definition: A fetal condition characterised by an accumulation of fluid or oedema in at least two fetal compartments, including subcutaneous compartments, the pleura, the pericardium, or the abdomen that is not due to the breakdown of red blood cells.

title: Congenital hypoplastic anaemia
definition: A paediatric condition characterised by a decreased number of red blood cells (RBCs) or lower than the normal levels of haemoglobin in the blood of a newborn present at birth due to loss of blood from the circulatory system of the fetus.

title: Malassezia infection in newborn
definition: A condition affecting newborns, caused by an infection with Malassezia that leads to a severe systemic inflammatory response. This condition is characterised by fever or respiratory distress. Confirmation is by identification of Malassezia in a blood sample.

title: Withdrawal symptoms from therapeutic use of drugs in newborn
definition: A paediatric condition characterised by the presence of symptoms due to drug withdrawal in a newborn.

title: Fetus and newborn affected by abnormality in fetal intrauterine heart rate or rhythm before onset of labour
Transitory tyrosinaemia of newborn
definition: Clinically asymptomatic elevated blood tyrosine level caused by late fetal maturation of 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase, usually detected on newborn bloodspot screening. Most commonly seen in premature infants receiving milk formulae with high protein content. Generally considered benign and resolves by 4-6 weeks of age.

title: Neonatal hyperbilirubinaemia due to total parenteral nutrition
definition: A paediatric condition characterised by persistently increased level of bilirubin above 85 umol/l (5 mg/dL) manifesting as yellowing of the eyes, skin, and other tissues of a newborn due to intravenous feeding which bypasses the normal processes of eating and digestion.

title: Cold panniculitis of the newborn
definition: Cold panniculitis resulting either from exposure of neonates to low environmental temperature or from local application of cold objects (e.g. ice packs for management of neonatal supraventricular tachycardia). The newborn are particularly susceptible as a result of a high saturated/unsaturated fat ratio in subcutaneous fat with a consequent elevation of the freezing point of fat.

title: Iatrogenic injuries involving the skin of the neonate
Preterm newborn, gestational age 34 completed weeks
definition: Preterm newborn, gestational age 34 weeks, 0 days through 34 weeks, 6 days

title: Prenatal intrauterine intestinal perforation
definition: In-utero or prenatal bowel perforation results in a chemical peritonitis (meconium peritonitis) from peritoneal leakage of sterile meconium. Meconium peritonitis results from prenatal intestinal perforation nearly always involving the small bowel.

title: Neonatal cerebral leukomalacia
definition: A paediatric condition characterised by the death of small areas of brain tissue creating "holes" in the brain of a newborn.

title: Acquired vocal cord paralysis in newborn
definition: Acquired vocal cord paralysis may result from birth trauma, result of the extracorporeal membrane oxygenation cannulation, thoracic surgery, or some infections. Unilateral vocal cord paralysis is more common and the left vocal cord is most frequently involved.

title: Miscellaneous specified conditions of integument specific to fetus or newborn
Other bacterial infections of the fetus or newborn
Exposure to tobacco smoke in the perinatal period
definition: Exposure to tobacco smoke in the perinatal period, both directly or through second hand smoke, can lead to: low birth weight, preterm delivery, Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS or cot death), spontaneous abortion, or intrauterine growth retardation.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by short umbilical cord
definition: An umbilical cord < 2 SD in length below mean for the gestational age. At term, this is < 35 cm. Often associated with fetal hypokinesia

title: Preterm newborn, gestational age 28 completed weeks
definition: Preterm newborn, gestational age 28 weeks, 0 days through 28 weeks, 6 days

title: Neonatal hyperbilirubinaemia due to enzymatic defect in bilirubin degradation
Benign or innocent cardiac murmurs in newborn
definition: A paediatric condition characterised by heart sounds that are produced as a result of turbulent blood flow that is sufficient to produce audible noise primarily due to physiologic conditions outside the heart, as opposed to structural defects in the heart itself in a newborn.

title: Neonatal lupus erythematosus
definition: Neonatal lupus erythematosus results from trans-placental transfer of maternal antibodies, in particular anti-Ro/SSA and anti La/SSB. It manifests with an erythematous rash which may be obviously photosensitive and is closely associated with congenital heart block. The mother may have known lupus, especially subacute cutaneous lupus erythematosus, but she may be asymptomatic. The rash normally subsides within the first few months of life.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by maternal chemotherapy
Neonatal hypocalcaemia
definition: Hypocalcaemia is a common metabolic problem in newborns. In the neonate, hypocalcaemia is defined by birth weight (BW) categories. In infants with BW greater than 1500 g, hypocalcaemia is defined as a total serum Calcium (Ca) concentration less than 8 mg/dL (2 mmol/L) or an ionized fraction of less than 4.4 mg/dL (1.1 mmol/L). In very low birth weight premature infants (BW<1500g), hypocalcaemia is defined as a total serum Ca concentration less than 7 mg/dL (1.75 mmol/L) or an ionized fraction of less than 4 mg/dL (1 mmol/L). Etiologies of early hypocalcaemia (occurs in the first two to three days after birth) include prematurity, maternal diabetes, birth asphyxia, and intrauterine growth. Causes of late hypocalcaemia (usually occurs at the end of the first week of life) include hypoparathyroidism and high phosphate intake. Most infants with hypocalcaemia are asymptomatic. If symptomatic, neuromuscular irritability is the most common sign with jitteriness and muscle jerking. Less common findings include seizures, and rarely laryngospasm, wheezing, or vomiting.

title: Cerebellar contusion due to birth injury
definition: A bruise of the brain tissue. There is a punctuate haemorrhage which occurs in the long gyri.

title: Neonatal disorders of the oral mucosa
Transient hyperinsulinaemic neonatal hypoglycaemia
definition: This refers to transient above normal level of insulin in the blood, and an abnormally diminished content of glucose in the blood, of a newborn.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by maternal exposure to environmental chemical substances
definition: A condition characterised by findings in the fetus or newborn due to the transmission of any substances derived from exposure of the mother to environmental chemicals.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by maternal anaemia
Fetus or newborn affected by maternal death
definition: A condition characterised by findings in the fetus or newborn due to death of the mother.

title: Pneumomediastinum originating in the perinatal period
definition: Presence of air in the mediastinum usually from tracking of free air from ruptured alveolar ducts along the perivascular sheaths of pulmonary blood vessels, or rupture of subpleural bleb

title: Fungal infection of fetus or newborn
definition: Any condition affecting fetuses or newborns, caused by an infection with a fungal agent.

title: Neonatal diabetes mellitus
definition: Neonatal diabetes mellitus (NDM) is a monogenic form of diabetes that occurs in the first 6 months of life. It is a rare condition occurring in only one in 100,000 to 500,000 live births. Infants with NDM do not produce enough insulin, leading to an increase in blood glucose. NDM can be mistaken for the much more common type 1 diabetes, but type 1 diabetes usually occurs later than the first 6 months of life. In about half of those with NDM, the condition is lifelong and is called permanent neonatal diabetes mellitus (PNDM). In the rest of those with NDM, the condition is transient and disappears during infancy but can reappear later in life; this type of NDM is called transient neonatal diabetes mellitus (TNDM).

title: Fetal blood loss from placenta
definition: fetal blood loss can result from placental abruption, which is when the placenta separates from the uterine wall prior to delivery. Placental abruptions occur under conditions of maternal hypertension and drug use (e.g. cocaine), maternal vascular and collagen vascular disease, maternal clotting disorders, and following direct abdominal trauma. fetal blood loss can also result from accidental incision of the placenta during a caesarean section.

title: Transient neonatal myasthenia gravis
definition: A paediatric condition characterised as a temporary autoimmune neuromuscular disease leading to fluctuating muscle weakness and fatigue in a newborn.

title: Neonatal bleeding originating in the oesophagus, stomach, small or large intestine
definition: Bleeding in the neonate that originates from the digestive system. Most common causes include enteritis, gastritis, milk protein allergies, intussusception, and/or erosions of mucosa.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by gestational oedema or proteinuria without hypertension
Transient tachypnoea of newborn
definition: Transient tachypnoea of newborn is usually a benign self-limiting illness of term and near-term infants demonstrating increased respiratory rate and requiring supplementary oxygen after birth.

title: Fetus or newborn affected by maternal conditions that may be unrelated to present pregnancy
definition: A group of conditions characterised by findings in the fetus or newborn due to conditions associated with the mother which are unrelated to the present pregnancy.

title: Neonatal pemphigus
definition: Neonatal pemphigus vulgaris is a short lived autoimmune skin diseases arising as a result of transplacental transmission to the neonate of maternal antibodies. Neonatal pemphigus is characterised by blister formation on the skin and the mucous membranes mediated by auto-antibodies to the desmosome component desmoglein 3.

title: Birth injury to spleen
definition: Rupture or subcapsular haemorrhage into spleen as a result of birth trauma; may present as haemoperitoneum

title: Fetus or newborn affected by abnormal uterine contractions
definition: Abnormal uterine contractions can either be hypertonic or hypotonic. Hypertonic contractions are ones that occur more frequently and are marked by an increase in resting tone to more than 15 mm Hg. Hypotonic contractions are ones where the number of contractions is unusually low, the resting tone of the uterus is less than 10 mm Hg, and the strength of contractions is consistently < 26 mm Hg.

title: Neonatal infections of certain specified sites
Rh isoimmunization of fetus or newborn
definition: A condition characterised by the transmission of antibodies from a mother to the child via the placenta against the Rhesus factor of blood. Such antibodies were developed in an Rhesus factor negative mother subsequent to exposure to Rhesus positive factor blood resulting in the break-down of the red blood cells of the fetus.

title: Late metabolic acidosis of newborn
