title: WHODAS 2.0 36-item version
definition:
!markdown
This subsection includes the domains and questions for use with the WHO Disability Assessment Schedule 2.0 (WHODAS 2.0) 36 item version. The WHODAS 2.0 captures an individual’s level of functioning in six major life domains of the “activity and participation” dimension: cognition, mobility, self-care, getting along, life activities and participation in society. For all domains, the WHODAS 2.0 36-item version provides domain-specific and overall summary score of functioning. 
The table below provides the classification of severity of the functioning problem, based on the response received to the question related to the relevant functioning category. 
For coding, the relevant additional digit is added after the decimal point to the code of the relevant functioning category.

+----------------------+-----------------------------------+
|**additional digit**  |**Level of functioning problem**   |
+======================+===================================+
| .0                   |   None  (no problem)              |
+----------------------+-----------------------------------+
| .1                   |   Mild                            |
+----------------------+-----------------------------------+
| .2                   |   Moderate                        |
+----------------------+-----------------------------------+
| .3                   |   Severe                          |
+----------------------+-----------------------------------+
| .4                   |   Extreme or cannot do            |
+----------------------+-----------------------------------+

title: Health drain on financial resources [WHODAS]
definition: In the past 30 days, how much has your health been a drain on the financial resources of you or your family?

title: Recreation and leisure
definition: Engaging in any form of play, recreational or leisure activity, such as informal or organized play and sports, programmes of physical fitness, relaxation, amusement or diversion, going to art galleries, museums, cinemas or theatres; engaging in crafts or hobbies, reading for enjoyment, playing musical instruments; sightseeings, tourism and travelling for pleasure.

title: Eating
definition: Carrying out the coordinated tasks and actions of eating food that has been served, bringing it to the mouth and consuming it in culturally acceptable ways, cutting or breaking food into pieces, opening containers and packets, using eating implements, having meals, feasting or dining.

title: Neuromusculoskeletal and movement-related functions
definition: This chapter is about the functions of movement and mobility, including functions of joints, bones, reflexes and muscles.

title: Looking after one's health
definition: Ensuring physical comfort, health and physical and mental well-being, such as by maintaining a balanced diet, and an appropriate level of physical activity, keeping warm or cool, avoiding harms to health, following safe sex practices, including such as using condoms, getting immunizations and regular physical examinations.

title: Eating [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in eating?

title: Doing most important work or school task [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in doing your most important work/school tasks well?

title: Sleep functions
definition: General mental functions of periodic, reversible and selective physical and mental disengagement from one's immediate environment accompanied by characteristic physiological changes.

title: Functions of the digestive, metabolic and endocrine systems
definition: This chapter is about the functions of ingestion, digestion and elimination, as well as functions involved in metabolism and the endocrine glands.

title: Caring for body parts
definition: Looking after those parts of the body, such as skin, face, teeth, scalp, nails and genitals, that require more than washing and drying.

title: Communicating with - receiving - spoken messages [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in generally understanding what people say?

title: Transferring oneself
definition: Moving from one surface to another, such as sliding along a bench or moving from a bed to a chair, without changing body position.

title: Major life areas
definition: This chapter is about carrying out the tasks and actions required to engage in education, work and employment and to conduct economic transactions.

title: Seeing and related functions [BMDS]
definition: How much difficulty do you have seeing things at a distance [without glasses]?

title: Walking
definition: Moving along a surface on foot, step by step, so that one foot is always on the ground, such as when strolling, sauntering, walking forwards, backwards, or sideways.

title: Handling stress and other psychological demands
definition: Carrying out simple or complex and coordinated actions to manage and control the psychological demands required to carry out tasks demanding significant responsibilities and involving stress, distraction, or crises, such as driving a vehicle during heavy traffic or taking care of many children.

title: Sexual functions
definition: Mental and physical functions related to the sexual act, including the arousal, preparatory, orgasmic and resolution stages.

title: Dressing [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in getting dressed?

title: Memory functions
definition: Specific mental functions of registering and storing information and retrieving it as needed.

title: Functions of the cardiovascular, haematological, immunological and respiratory systems
definition: This chapter is about the functions involved in the cardiovascular system (functions of the heart and blood vessels), the haematological and immunological systems (functions of blood production and immunity), and the respiratory system (functions of respiration and exercise tolerance).

title: Getting all needed housework done [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in getting all the household work done that you need to do?

title: Time spent on health condition [WHODAS]
definition: In the past 30 days, how much time did you spend on your health condition, or its consequences?

title: Conversation [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in starting and maintaining a conversation?

title: Washing oneself [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in washing your whole body?

title: Energy and drive functions
definition: General mental functions of physiological and psychological mechanisms that cause the individual to move towards satisfy specific needs and general goals in a persistent manner.

title: Communicating with - receiving - spoken messages
definition: Comprehending literal and implied meanings of messages in spoken language, such as understanding that a statement asserts a fact or is an idiomatic expression.

title: Communication
definition: This chapter is about general and specific features of communicating by language, signs and symbols, including receiving and producing messages, carrying on conversations, and using communication devices and techniques.

title: Dressing
definition: Carrying out the coordinated actions and tasks of putting on and taking off clothes and footwear in sequence and in keeping with climatic and social conditions, such as by putting on, adjusting and removing shirts, skirts, blouses, pants, undergarments, saris, kimono, tights, hats, gloves, coats, shoes, boots, sandals and slippers.

title: Maintaining a standing position [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in standing for long periods such as 30 minutes?

title: Carrying out daily routine
definition: Carrying out simple or complex and coordinated actions in order to plan, manage and complete the requirements of day-to-day procedures or duties, such as budgeting time and making plans for separate activities throughout the day.

title: Exercise tolerance functions
definition: Functions related to respiratory and cardiovascular capacity as required for enduring physical exertion.

title: Hearing and vestibular functions [BMDS]
definition: How much difficulty do you have hearing [without hearing aids]?

title: Intimate relationships [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in sexual activities?

title: Basic interpersonal interactions
definition: Interacting with people in a contextually and socially appropriate manner, such as by showing consideration and esteem when appropriate, or responding to the feelings of others.

title: Basic learning [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in learning a new task, for example, learning how to get a new place?

title: Functions of the skin and related structures
definition: This chapter is about the functions of skin, nails and hair.

title: Washing oneself
definition: Washing and drying one's whole body, or body parts, using water and appropriate cleaning and drying materials or methods, such as bathing, showering, washing hands and feet, face and hair, and drying with a towel.

title: Intimate relationships
definition: Creating and maintaining close or romantic relationships between individuals, such as husband and wife, lovers or sexual partners.

title: Solving problems
definition: Finding solutions to questions or situations by identifying and analysing issues, developing options and solutions, evaluating potential effects of solutions, and executing a chosen solution, such as in resolving a dispute between two people.

title: Moving around within the home [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in moving around inside your home?

title: Relating with strangers [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in dealing with people you do not know?

title: Getting all needed work or school work done [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in getting all the work done that you need to do?

title: Doing most important household tasks [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in doing most important household tasks well?

title: Mental functions
definition: This chapter is about the functions of the brain: both global mental functions, such as consciousness, energy and drive, and specific mental functions, such as memory, language and calculation mental functions.

title: Moving around using equipment
definition: Moving the whole body from place to place, on any surface or space, by using specific devices designed to facilitate moving or create other ways of moving around, such as with skates, skis, or scuba equipment, or moving down the street in a self-propelled wheelchair or a walker.

title: Problems in relaxation or pleasure [WHODAS]
definition: In the past 30 days, how much of a problem did you have in doing things by yourself for relaxation or pleasure?

title: Difficulties in daily work or school [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in your day to day work/school?

title: Maintaining a standing position
definition: Staying in a standing position for some time such as when standing in a queue.

title: Genitourinary and reproductive functions
definition: This chapter is about the functions of urination and the reproductive functions, including sexual and procreative functions.

title: Family relationships [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in getting along with people who are close to you?

title: Toileting
definition: Planning and carrying out the elimination of human waste (menstruation, urination and defecation), and clean oneself afterwards.

title: Solving problems [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in analysing and finding solutions to problems in day to day life?

title: Learning and applying knowledge
definition: This chapter is about learning, applying the knowledge that is learned, thinking, solving problems, and making decisions.

title: Self-care
definition: This chapter is about caring for oneself, washing and drying oneself, caring for one's body and body parts, dressing, eating and drinking, and looking after one's health.

title: Preparing meals
definition: Planning, organizing, cooking and serving simple and complex meals for oneself and others, such as by making a menu, selecting edible food and drink, getting together ingredients for preparing meals,cooking with heat and preparing cold foods and drinks, and serving the food.

title: Attention functions [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in concentrating on doing something for ten minutes?

title: Functions related to the digestive system
Voice functions
definition: Functions of the production of various sounds by the passage of air through the larynx.

title: Human rights [WHODAS]
definition: In the past 30 days, how much of a problem did you have living with dignity because of the attitudes and actions of others?

title: Conversation
definition: Starting, sustaining and ending an interchange of thoughts and ideas, carried out by means of spoken, written, signed or other forms of language, with one or more people one knows or who are strangers, in formal or casual settings.

title: Mobility
definition: This chapter is about moving by changing body position or location or by transferring from one place to another, by carrying, moving or manipulating objects, by walking, running or climbing, and by using various forms of transportation.

title: Human rights
definition: Enjoying all nationally and internationally recognized rights that are accorded to people by virtue of their humanity alone, such as human rights as recognized by the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights (1948), the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child (1989), the United Nations Standard Rules for the Equalization of Opportunities for Persons with Disabilities (1993), and the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (2006); the right to self-determination or autonomy; and the right to control over one's destiny.

title: Participation and impact of health problems [WHODAS]
Moving around outside the home and other buildings [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in getting out of your home?

title: Memory functions [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in remembering to do important things?

title: Emotional functions
definition: Specific mental functions related to the feeling and affective components of the processes of the mind.

title: Community, social and civic life
definition: This chapter is about the actions and tasks required to engage in organized social life outside the family, in community, social and civic areas of life.

title: Supplementary section for functioning assessment
definition:
The section allows for creating functioning profiles and overall functioning scores of individuals, which are suitable to describe and quantify the level of functioning associated with a health conditions.

To guide functioning assessment, the section includes two ICF-based instruments developed by WHO: the WHO Disability Assessment Schedule (WHODAS 2.0 36-item version), and the Model Disability Survey (MDS). 

The section is complemented by a generic set of functioning categories of high explanatory power derived from the ICF Annex 9.

title: Brief Model Disability Survey
definition: This subsection includes the domains and questions for use with the WHO Model Disability Survey (MDS) brief version. The brief MDS includes body functions as well as activities and participation categories. The brief MDS allows to generate an overall summary score of functioning.

title: Health problems causing family problems [WHODAS]
definition: In the past 30 days, how much of a problem did your family have because of your health problems?

title: Getting household work done quickly [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in getting your household work done as quickly as needed?

title: Carrying out daily routine [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in staying by yourself for a few days?

title: Attention functions
definition: Specific mental functions of focusing on an external stimulus or internal experience for the required period of time.

title: Changing body position - standing [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in standing up from sitting down?

title: Voice and speech functions
definition: This chapter is about the functions of producing sounds and speech.

title: Generic functioning domains
definition: This subsection contains a generic set of functioning categories of high explanatory power derived from the ICF Annex 9.

title: Remunerative employment
definition: Engaging in all aspects of work, as an occupation, trade, profession or other form of employment, for payment, as an employee, full or part time, or self-employed, such as seeking employment and getting a job, doing the required tasks of the job, attending work on time as required, supervising other workers or being supervised, and performing required tasks alone or in groups.

title: Doing housework
definition: Managing a household by cleaning the house, washing clothes, using household appliances, storing food and disposing of garbage, such as by sweeping, mopping, washing counters, walls and other surfaces; collecting and disposing of household garbage; tidying rooms, closets and drawers; collecting, washing, drying, folding and ironing clothes; cleaning footwear; using brooms, brushes and vacuum cleaners; using washing machines, dryers and irons.

title: Mobility of joint functions
definition: Functions of the range and ease of movement of a joint.

title: Taking care of household responsibilities [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in taking care of your household responsibilities?

title: General tasks and demands
definition: This chapter is about general aspects of carrying out single or multiple tasks, organizing routines and handling stress. These items can be used in conjunction with more specific tasks or actions to identify the underlying features of the execution of tasks under different circumstances.

title: Relating with strangers
definition:
Engaging in temporary contacts and links with strangers for specific purposes, such as asking for directions or making a purchase.
Engaging in temporary contacts and links with strangers for specific purposes, such as when asking for information, directions or making a purchase.

title: Urination functions
definition: Functions of discharge of urine from the urinary bladder.

title: Recreation and leisure [WHODAS]
definition: In the past 30 days, how much of a problem did you have in joining in community activities (for example: festivities, religious or other activities) in the same way as anyone else can?

title: Sensation of pain
definition: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure.

title: Sensory functions and pain
definition: This chapter is about the functions of the senses, seeing, hearing, tasting and so on, as well as the sensation of pain.

title: Interpersonal interactions and relationships
definition: This chapter is about carrying out the actions and tasks required for basic and complex interactions with people (strangers, friends, relatives, family members and lovers) in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

title: Domestic life
definition: This chapter is about carrying out domestic and everyday actions and tasks. Areas of domestic life include, caring for one's belongings and space, acquiring food, clothing and other necessities, household cleaning and repairing, caring for personal and other household objects, and assisting others.

title: Emotional effect of health condition [WHODAS]
definition: In the past 30 days, how much have you been emotionally affected by your health condition?

title: Informal relationship with friends - maintaining [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in maintaining a friendship?

title: Moving around within the home
definition: Walking and moving around in one's home, within a room, between rooms, and around the whole residence or living area.

title: Using transportation
definition: Using transportation to move around as a passenger, such as being driven in a car, bus, rickshaw, jitney, pram or stroller, wheelchair, animal-powered vehicle, private or public taxi, train, tram, subway, boat or aircraft and using humans for transportation.

title: Assisting others
definition: Assisting household members and others with their learning, communicating, self-care, movement, within the house or outside; being concerned about the well-being of household members and others.

title: Getting remunerative work or school work done quickly [WHODAS]
definition: Because of your health condition, in the past 30 days, how much difficulty did you have in getting your work done as quickly as needed?

title: Muscle power functions
definition: Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of a muscle or muscle groups.

title: NYHA Class IV - Unable to carry on any physical activity without discomfort
definition: Unable to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Symptoms of heart failure at rest. If any physical activity is undertaken, discomfort increases.

title: Pancreatic peptide and pancreatic peptide-like peptide within terminal tyrosine amide producing tumour
Superficial branch of the lateral superior genicular artery
Extender component of medical device
definition: A component designed to lengthen a structure.

title: Intermittent energy output
definition: Problem associated with the energy output from the device being inconsistent over time.

title: Vehicle user role of person injured in transport event
Lymphatic system of the pelvis and perineum
Type of sport or exercise activity, triathlon - cycling event
Cable, electrical component of medical device
definition: A long, thin, multistranded electrical wire designed to carry signals or power over a distance.

title: Failure to unfold or unwrap
definition: Problem associated with the comprising materials' deformation in that device fails to open its wrapping or open/extend in a certain manner i.e. balloon or lens.

title: NYHA Class III - Marked limitation of physical activity
definition: Marked limitation of physical activity. Comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary activity causes fatigue, palpitation or dyspnoea.

title: Suntan or sunscreen products, self-tan products
Hub component of medical device
definition: An electronic component designed as a central connection for other devices or components.

title: Monomer liquid component of medical device
definition: The liquid that reacts with the polymer powder to form adhesive, resin, or cement.

title: Display component of medical device
definition: A component designed to present information visually.

title: Oesophageal squamous intraepithelial neoplasia (dysplasia), low grade
Part of building or grounds, other specified outdoor part of building or grounds
Fibroblast growth factor receptor tyrosine kinase inhibitors
Partial blockage
definition: Problem related to an obstruction or blockage within the device component (e.g. tube, opening, pipe) that results in a reduction of the flow rate.

title: Rod or shaft component of medical device
definition: A long cylindrical bar used to transmit motion or connect other components.

title: Indadequate user interface
definition: Problem associated with the means by which the operator and the equipment communicate or interact.

title: Sparking
definition: Problem associated with a flash of light related to an electrical discharge into a normally non conductive medium, such as air. Not associated with a discharge between two conductive surfaces.

title: Adenocarcinoma in situ in villous adenoma
Low powered passenger vehicle as counterpart in land transport crash
definition: (1) A land transport motor vehicle with three wheels (usually one in front and two behind), designed primarily for on-road use. Globally, most commonly used as taxis. Design, construction, type of motor and registration/licensing requirements vary widely. (2) A low-powered quadricycle or other low-powered four-wheeled passenger vehicle that is not a car.

title: Type of sport or exercise activity, skiing - Nordic cross country
Carbon monoxide from incomplete combustion of acetylene
Conclusion not yet available regarding problem with device
Latch fastner component of medical device
definition: A fastening component for a mobile part usually consisting of a bar that is retained in a slot.

title: Poisonous plant stem, not elsewhere classified
Pacing intermittently
definition: Problem associated with the failure of pacing device for a limited period of time, following which the item recovers its ability to perform its required function without being subjected to any external corrective action. Note: such as failure is often recurrent.

title: Personal countermeasures, padding of joint, bony prominence, or muscle
Unpaid cleaning, cooking or maintenance at own place of residence
Context of assault, altercation about personally-held views regarding politics
Dull or blunt
definition: Problem associated with a device not being as sharp as intended or expected.

title: Contact allergens in industrial biocides, cutting oils or disinfectants
Papillary tumour of the pineal region
Clumping in device or device ingredient
definition: Problem associated with the aggregation of particles into irregular masses.

title: Wall or related fitting or feature
Type of sport or exercise activity, track and field - triple jump
Mixed squamous cell and glandular papilloma
Chemical problem
definition: Problem associated with any from the documented specifications of the device that relate to any chemical characterization, i.e., element, compound, or mixture.

title: Liner component of medical device
definition: A component placed the inside of the walls of a cavity or container for protection or insulation.

title: Environmental countermeasures in sport or exercise
Motorcar as counterpart in land transport crash
Table, stand, cupboard, shelf or partition
Type of sport or exercise activity, snow boarding
Cause traced to transport or storage
Adenocarcinoma in situ in adenomatous polyp
Thermal problem with device identified
definition: Problems related to the temperature of the device.

title: Communications problem with device identified
definition: Devices that do not send or receive adequate signals (this speaks to the interoperability between devices).

title: Failure to fire
definition: Problem associated with failure of the device to discharge its load (e.g. surgical stapler failed to partially or completely deploy its staples).

title: Therapy-related acute myeloid leukaemia, alkylating agent related
New or unknown interferent problem with device identified
definition: New or unknown endogenous or exogenous interferent (sample) identified.

title: Compatibility problem
definition: Problem associated with compatibility between device, patients or substances (medication, body fluid, etc.)

title: Device markings or labelling problem
definition: Problem associated with the written, printed or graphic material accompanying or affixed to the device or any of its packaging. This includes verbal instructions relating to identification, technical description, and usage provided by the device manufacturers. Problems can include but are not limited to this material being unclear, missing, worn out, incorrect or inaccurate.

title: Self-propelled agricultural machine as mode of transport of person injured in transport related event
Type of sport or exercise activity, decathlon - 1,500 metre event
Acquired cystic disease associated renal cell carcinoma
Infant or child product, marble, bead
Type of sport or exercise activity, track and field - shot putt
Fiber component of medical device
definition: Any component made from a long, slender material.

title: Type of sport or exercise activity, judo
Afferent arteriole of the interlobular artery
Equipment pole component of medical device
definition: A structural component designed to hang medical equipment.

title: Carbon monoxide from engine driven electrical generator
Diaphragm component of medical device
definition: A component consisting of a flexible sheet or partition.

title: Context of assault, selling drugs or drug business
Venomous or toxic plant, not elsewhere classified
Stretched
definition: Problem associated with an increase or elongation in a materials' dimension.

title: Type of sport or exercise activity, gymnastics - floor exercise or tumbling
Insufficient flow or under infusion
definition: Problem associated with an insufficient dose of therapeutic agents, e.g., drugs or fluids being delivered into a patient under positive pressure.

title: Tolerance stack-up identified in device
definition: Problems that result from a combination of specification variances of the components.

title: Adenocarcinoma with cartilaginous and osseous metaplasia
Controlled fire, flame in building or structure
Agents in bile and liver therapy
Burns involving less than 5% of body surface
Central nervous system stimulants opiate antagonists
Clamp fastner component of medical device
definition: A component designed to mechanically hold items firmly together.

title: False alarm
definition: Problem associated with the device providing incorrect alarm warning or alert to user.

title: Early Neonatal
definition: The period of time from birth through the seventh day of life.

title: Application program problem, power calculation error
definition: Problem associated with the written program code or application software used by the device for calculations related to device power.

title: Adenocarcinoma of lung, mixed mucinous and non-mucinous
Part of building or grounds, playground
Psychoactive drug use, suspicion or evidence of psychoactive drug use by the injured person
Full thickness or deep full thickness burn involving 60-69% of body surface
Exposure to being struck by moving object
Chronic lymphoproliferative disorder of NK cells
Radiofrequency interference with device identified
definition: Problems due to radiofrequency interference. RFI is a disturbance that affects an electrical circuit due to either electromagnetic conduction or electromagnetic radiation emitted from an external source.

title: Sport utility vehicle as counterpart in land transport crash
Well differentiated papillary mesothelioma of the pleura
Failure of device to self-test
definition: Problem associated with the device failing to perform an internal self-diagnostic process to ensure normal operation during or prior to use.

title: Diagnosis timing in relation to surgical procedure
Type of sport or exercise activity, jujitsu
Difficult or delayed positioning
definition: Problem associated with users experiencing difficulty or delay to position the device to a specified location.

title: Transport or storage problem with device identified
definition: Problems was caused by transport or storage conditions.

title: Touchscreen component of medical device
definition: A control component that operates the device following pressing the display on the screen.

title: Biocompatibility problem with device identified
definition: The device causes cellular or tissue responses that elicit an undesirable local or systemic effect in the recipient or beneficiary of that therapy. (See ISO 10993)

title: Fracture does not extend into joint
definition: Fractures that do not involve an articular surface.

title: Scanner component of medical device
definition: An electronic component that generates a digital representation of an image for data input to a computer; or a receiver designed to search for a signal within a specified frequency range.

title: Context of assault, mercy killing or euthanasia
Exposure to being struck, kicked, or bumped
Proximal risk factors for intentional self-harm, Other manner of death of a relative, partner or friend
Type of sport or exercise activity, road cycling
Streptococcus, group A
definition: Streptococcus is a genus of spherical Gram-positive bacteria belonging to the phylum Firmicutes and the lactic acid bacteria group. Staphylococcus is a genus of Gram-positive bacteria. Under the microscope, they appear round (cocci), and form in grape-like clusters. This diagnosis is, group A, as the cause of diseases classified to other chapters.

title: Pressure sensor component of medical device
definition: A sensor designed to respond to the level of pressure in a space or pressing on a surface.

title: Adhesive fastner component of medical device
definition: Any substance that affixes 2 or more surfaces together. This may be supplied separately, or attached to another item such as tape.

title: Drugs for treatment of hyperkalaemia, hypercalcaemia and hyperphosphataemia
Hose component of medical device
definition: A flexible tube designed to carry a fluid or gas.

title: Type of sport or exercise activity, equestrian steeplechase
Sword, dagger, bayonet, machete, panga, cutlass
Fishing boat or trawler as mode of transport of person injured in transport related event
Unsealed device packaging
definition: Problem associated with the loss of packaging seal.

title: Deformation problem with device identified
definition: Problems caused by changes in the shape or size of the device due to an applied force. This can be a result of tensile forces, compressive forces, shear, bending, tensile (pulling), or torsion.

title: Type of sport or exercise activity, volleyball
Funicular or monorail as counterpart in land transport crash
Antenna component of medical device
definition: A component designed to transmit or receive electromagnetic signals.

title: Outcome of deep full thickness or complex burn
definition: Whether a deep full thickness or complex burn, has resulted in the loss of a limb.

title: Large or heavy fixed object as counterpart in land transport crash
Type of sport or exercise activity, biathlon - shooting event
Fail-safe problem
definition: Problem associated with the feature that prevents the unsafe use of the device.

title: Joints and ligaments of the lower extremity
Carbon monoxide from incomplete combustion of coke
Noise, audible
definition: Problem associated with any unintended sound which emanates from the device (for example, squeaking from two parts rubbing together or buzzing sounds from electrical components).

title: Trailer or sidecar attached to a pedal cycle as mode of transport of person injured in transport related event
Hepatic branch of the left gastric artery
Antidepressant selective serotonin norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor
Difficult to advance
definition: Problem associated with difficulty moving the device to an intended location (e.g. difficulty in advancing guide wire).

title: Sternal branches of the internal thoracic artery
Anticoagulant antagonists, vitamin K and other coagulants
Integrated circuit chip component of medical device
definition: A microelectronic circuit that incorporates many interconnected transistors and other components.

title: Type of sport or exercise activity, abseiling or rappelling
Pointer component of medical device
definition: An indicator component designed to show a position on a scale.

title: Application program version or upgrade problem
definition: Problem associated with installing updates to a software system that affects the device performance or communication with another device.

title: Choriocarcinoma combined with other germ cell elements
Maintenance problem with device identified
definition: A device malfunction or problem that occurs after production because the device was not properly maintained according to the instructions (e.g. maintenance may be performed by user facility, distributor, or service provider).

title: Intermittent loss of power
definition: Problem associated with an intermittent disruption to the power to run the device.

title: IgM monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance
No display or image
definition: Problem associated with the absence of display or image.

title: Farm or other place of primary production
Device deployer component of medical device
definition: A component designed to install something or distribute something in a systematic way.

title: Myeloid and lymphoid neoplasms with PDGFRA rearrangement
Hovercraft operating on land or swamp as counterpart in land transport crash
Mixed pancreatic endocrine and exocrine tumour, malignant
Mesonephromas, uncertain whether benign or malignant
Diphtheria tetanus, acellular pertussis, inactivated polio virus, haemophilus Influenzae type B vaccines
Pulmonary myxoid sarcoma with EWSR1-CREB1 translocation
Proper palmar digital nerves of median nerve
Extended periods of work in a kneeling position
Increased pump speed
definition: Unintended increase in pump speed and hence, probably, flow rate, compromising the intended function of the device.

title: Rapid onset
definition: Rapid or sudden onset of a condition/illness that requires more immediate and/or aggressive treatment

title: Person responsible to resume manual control of a vehicle under autonomous or partly autonomous control injured in transport related event
Person on foot as counterpart in land transport crash
Testing of device from other lot or batch returned from user
definition: The investigation employed relevant empirical testing of the device of another lot or batch than that of the suspected device in the reported adverse event in order to support the identification of possible causes for the adverse event. This includes devices without a lot/batch designation. The device was returned from the user. Relevant testing would typically be based on test methods used for evaluating safety and performance as described in the technical file. Relevant testing would typically be based on test methods used for evaluating safety and performance as described in the latest relevant standards.

title: Type of sport or exercise activity, netball
Gas leak
definition: Problem associated with the unintended escape of a gas from the container in which it is housed.

title: Coagulation in device or device ingredient
definition: Problem associated with the undesired characterization of congealing, solidifying, thickening, curdling.

title: Motorised wheelchair as mode of transport of person injured in transport related event
Packaging problem
definition: Problem associated with the materials used to construct the cover or outer wrapping of the device.

title: Vitamin A derivative and other anti-acne preparations for systemic use
Grade 0 Category 0: Asymptomatic -no hemodynamically significant occlusive disease
definition: Objective criteria: Normal treadmill or reactive hyperemia test

title: Ventilation problem in device environment
definition: Problem associated with the circulation of fresh air in the immediate atmosphere in which the device is being used.

title: Person being transported by a vehicle and occupying space on a running board injured in transport related event
Codeine, codeine derivatives and other opioids used in cough suppression
Tool, machine, apparatus mainly used for work-related activity
Output below specifications
definition: Device output is below the documented specifications of the device.

title: Motor scooter as counterpart in land transport crash

The code for the presence of psychosocial factors is appropriate when there is positive evidence that psychological or social factors contribute to the cause, the maintenance or the exacerbation of the health condition, or associated disability, or when the health condition results in negative psychobehavioral consequences (eg, demoralisation, hopelessness, avoidance, withdrawal). Assigning this extension code does not require a judgement regarding aetiological contributions or causal priorities.

definition: These codes have assigned based on the landscape documents that have been prepared by the World Health Organization (WHO) for information purposes only concerning the 2019-2020 pandemic of the novel coronavirus. Inclusion of any particular product or entity in any of these landscape documents does not constitute, and shall not be deemed or construed as, any approval or endorsement by WHO of such product or entity (or any of its businesses or activities). While WHO takes reasonable steps to verify the accuracy of the information presented in these landscape documents, WHO does not make any (and hereby disclaims all) representations and warranties regarding the accuracy, completeness, fitness for a particular purpose (including any of the aforementioned purposes), quality, safety, efficacy, merchantability and/or non-infringement of any information provided in these landscape documents and/or of any of the products referenced therein. WHO also disclaims any and all liability or responsibility whatsoever for any death, disability, injury, suffering, loss, damage or other prejudice of any kind that may arise from or in connection with the procurement, distribution or use of any product included in any of these landscape documents.

Problems is not adequately described by any other term.

No apparent adverse event

A report has been received but the description provided does not appear to relate to an adverse event.
This code allows a report to be recorded for administration purposes, even if it doesn't meet the requirements for adverse event reporting.

title: Extension Codes
definition:
!markdown
Extension codes should never be used in primary classification coding or tabulation. 
- They are provided for use as supplementary or additional codes when desired to identify more detail in statistical categories classified elsewhere. 
- Extension codes may be used alone in other contexts.

title: Human respiratory syncytial virus
definition: This is a virus that causes respiratory tract infections. It is a major cause of lower respiratory tract infections and hospital visits during infancy and childhood. This diagnosis is the cause of diseases classified to other chapters.

title: Carbon monoxide from motor vehicle exhaust
Adenovirus
definition: Adenovirus infections most commonly cause illness of the respiratory system; however, depending on the infecting serotype, they may also cause various other illnesses and presentations. This diagnosis the cause of diseases classified to other chapters.

title: Erroneous data transfer in device identified
definition: The device software fails to transfer the expected data within a system or to another device.

title: Pain intensity
definition: Pain intensity is defined as the strength of the subjective pain experience (“how much does the pain hurt?”) The patient should be asked to rate the average pain intensity for the last week on an 11-point numerical rating scale (ranging from 0 ‘no pain’ to 10 ‘worst pain imaginable’) or a 100mm visual rating scale.

title: Applicator component of medical device
definition: A component designed to transfer a substance to a surface.

title: Other component of medical device
definition: Terms not yet classified. If these terms get moved to other categories, this category can be deleted. (Previously the device category.)

title: Oesophageal glandular dysplasia (intraepithelial neoplasia), low grade
Diphtheria, hepatitis B, pertussis, tetanus vaccines
Environmental countermeasures, no protective devices used
Arrow or bolt designed as weapon
Inaccurate synchronization
definition: Problem associated with an error due to imperfect timing of two operations, e.g. signal transmission time.

title: Fire
definition: Problem associated with the combustion of the device with a steady flame.

title: Chemicals used as process regulators
definition: Includes: Accelerators, activators, oxidation agents, reducing agent

title: Low audible alarm
definition: The audible device alarm cannot be heard clearly.

title: Type of sport or exercise activity, wind surfing

definition: Unintended complete loss of pressure, compromising the device's intended function.

title: Mild pain

Relevant testing would typically be based on test methods used for evaluating safety and performance as described in the latest relevant standards.
